storyInfo: A gang called Glasgow leaves Londinium, and so a tale of Vina Victoria begins.

attributes.text: Isabelle Montague, loyal Victorian Knight of the Tower once saidâ€”
\n'History is like a granary.'
\nIt stands in silence amidst the bustling estate, an unremarkable sight with a somewhat unpleasant scent of mold. Only ever thought of when stowing something away.
Containment. Silently containing things is its sole purpose.
\nAs for people, they are like stalks of wheat growing out in the fields, braving the elements so they might sprout those precious, precious ears.
\nAll you have experienced will become shining, golden grain, stored within the granary called history.
\nIt's more apt to say that history is a showroom of human lives.

attributes.content: Shining and golden? Yeah, I'd say that was a shining, golden life...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, the sword is yours.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: It is your destiny.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: Father, is this...?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina! The hell're you doing?!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Stop swinging already! You've nearly beaten him dead!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: *huff*... *huff*...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina! It's time!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Got it!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina, who do you wish to be when you leave this palace?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I chooseâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.text: Perhaps this is how history runs its course. Those caught up in its flow won't accept things as they are, they will resist it with all their might.
\nBut reality always comes crashing down, slamming you into the ground over and over.
\nYou've got no choice but to get back up and figure a way to stand firm. You know the fight'll never end, and you've got to make ready for the next fist in your face.
\nUntil you've circled round and round to find yourself back where you started, albeit by some different pathâ€”

attributes.content: Wait, now that I think about it, Dagda might've said 'millstone'.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: 'History is like a millstone'?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I forgot what metaphor she used exactly, just that it's got to do with a mill or a windmill or something. The sort of thing that'll get people thinking of the sunset.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Ah, forget it. I never much fancied the way she talks all erudite like.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: When all's done, I'm here to record this... heart-pounding moment in history.
\nAs a witness to this particular point, as one who personally experienced some of these events, I felt the need to share the tale with those who come after.
\nIt's worth remembering, considering the many bitter lessons learned. It must not be forgotten, with too many painful sacrifices made.
\nSafe to say, the story's so twisty and turny that if you weren't there to see for yourself, you'd never guess where it ended upâ€”

attributes.content: Aha! I remember now! It was a ship!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: 'History is like a sailing ship adrift, and every age sees its share of experienced helmsmen who think to change its course...'
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: 'But in the end, none will truly ever know where the sunset and the river will take themâ€”'
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Bah, sod it, I don't need to copy the feel of those historical novels I read. It's my book. Why should I write it like how Vina's governess talks?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Lemme have a think on how I'd tell the story my way...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.text: This here's a tale of how a hoodlum became a hero. It's all about courage, friendship, conviction, and power.
\nThe heir to the King leaves the palace, and when she returns home, she's already fit to be called hero, standing alongside her merry band of mates.
\nThis epic begins the summer of the year we left, in the factories of Londinium's Norport Borough.

attributes.content: ...They were the happiest days of my life.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Muncaster.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Mm-hmm.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: ...Bristol.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Got any more?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Sheffi... Di... No, Glouâ€”
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Baird! Gimme a hint already! Vina? You really gonna watch me embarrass myself like this?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hey, it's your bet. I can't say anything.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Baird's right, wouldn't be fair otherwise.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Don't give up now, Indra. Victoria's got at least sixty or so nomadic cities. If you can think of one more, you're a sixth of the way there.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: My whole life I've never left Londinium. It's my home. Why the hell would I remember what some cities miles away are called?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You must be real fond of cleaning up the alleys back home, then.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Dammit, I shouldn't be acting like a smartarse!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Oh, Hannah, do you still recall the time we went to the video shop? After we were done duffing the Lane Brothers up?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I think I do? Didn't the film have a manor with white walls and a green lawn... Was it some kinda romance? It just went on and on.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Then do you remember what the leading lady loved eating the most at the nobles' banquetsâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: 'Sidmouth butter and vanilla roast fowlbeast'!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Yeah! Sidmouth! That's ten!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: *sigh*... Vina.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You really are the best when it comes to leading, Vina! I'll follow you my entire life, I will!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: No need to get all sappy on me now.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Alright, Morgan, you lost. Here's your drink.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: You know Vina helped her out, Baird... Ah, whatevs, drink's a drink.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan! It's your turn to pick up the protection money from the factories on Old Farleigh Road.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Don't forget to help clean up the alleyways behind Old Hank's sandwich shop.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: It's times like these that Glasgow feels spread a bit thin.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hah, one day, I'm gonna make all of Londinium into Glasgow Gang turf, and all those fees will come straight to us! Alongside the best sandwiches in the city!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: If you took all of Victoria under your wing, who'd you even protect them from? The Gaulish?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Maybe those snotty nobles? Who knows, some tosser's bound to show his face sooner or later.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Norport can't make do without us, and neither can Londinium. There'll come a day when Glasgow's the heroes of the whole city, just you wait.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Not wrong, I'd say.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Indeed. Here's to the Glasgow Gang, the most important gang in town.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: To the Glasgow Gang!
attributes.name: Glasgow Gang

attributes.content: <p=1>Cavendish Manor</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Did you enjoy the play?
attributes.name: Cheerful Noble

attributes.content: A Victorian duke's daughter falls in 'love' with a handsome Sarkaz youth.
attributes.name: Cheerful Noble

attributes.content: In order to eliminate this formidable rival, her would-be suitors conjure all sorts of dreadful devilish plots.
attributes.name: Cheerful Noble

attributes.content: Who would have thought the playwright who penned The Lady of Windsor could produce such a provocative work, albeit only after a hefty writer's fee.
attributes.name: Cheerful Noble

attributes.content: What do you think, Lady Allerdale?
attributes.name: Cheerful Noble

attributes.content: I can't say I'm too fond of the ending of Cemeteries of Londinium, Earl Morrill.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Under the heavy hand of persecution, the Duke's daughter and the Sarkaz lad elope, united in death as they are buried together in a public cemetery. A conclusion that's far too... formulaic.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I never expected a young lady such as yourself to have the tastes of a haranguing critic.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: Is it not enough to bring tears to your eyes?
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: To whose eyes? Duke Cavendish's, or the Sarkaz Regent's?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Tears will only serve to blind us, my Lord, and are often an accomplice to popular works harboring ill intent.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: A shame, truly. Here I was, thinking you would have some empathy for the leading lady, what with her bound to a fate beyond her control.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: Ah, I am so dreadfully sorry! Pray forgive my inadvertent offense. You must know that my family was once on good terms with the Cumberlands...
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: I don't really mind.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: It's common knowledge that Her Grace the Duke of Caster aided me at my lowest. I have only gratitude for her. I see no shame in my circumstances either.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Then since you're taking part in today's festivities, may I takes your words as Her Grace's own thoughts?
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: You may consider them a friendly reminder.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Londiniers should be wary of those mercenaries from Kazdel, heaven forbid some ridiculous story to sow the seeds of pity and sympathy in their unwitting minds.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Kazdel is far, far away, and they simply don't understand these Sarkaz in the slightest. Do not allow tears to blind their judgment, my Lord.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Your words would throttle a talented playwright.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: Bringing the citizenry to tears would hardly be a difficult thing for a duke, I say.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Is this also Her Grace's opinion on the matter?
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: No matter what you might think of this playwright, I do believe 'The Lady of Windsor' is a rare work of art. I whole-heartedly invite youâ€”and perhaps Duke Cavendishâ€”to give it a thorough read-through.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: 'Fins have not the limbs to drag themselves out of the swamp. Man has not the eye to see beyond time.'
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: If Duke Cavendish can understand these words and take them to heart, while keeping a wary eye on this matter, he can avoid becoming the next Duke Windsor.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: No offense meant, of course.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Oho, I must say I quite enjoy your incisive view on this topic, Lady Allerdale.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: The eye to see beyond time... A rare thing indeed. In comparison, ambition beyond one's means is as cheap as chips, wouldn't you say?
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: I can't say I disagree.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Despite the many years past, there are still those who have not forgotten that Victoria once had a king.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: And there are those who carry the former heir to the throne in mind, alongside that sword of royal authority.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: Duke Caster's actions are hardly inscrutable. Whenever she dispenses advice to the other dukes, do not forget that there are eyes upon her in turn.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: I will inform Her Grace, my Lord.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: It's getting late. I fear I must be heading off.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Not staying for dinner, Lady Cumberland?
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: I have an appointment with my tailor to prepare some winter clothes. I'm sure you're aware that summer in Londinium lasts but a few fleeting daysâ€”
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: But winter? Winter never comes late.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Then I shan't keep you any longer, my Lady.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: I shall send a ticket for opening night to you beforehand. If Her Grace would like to watch, Duke Cavendish would happily sponsor the troupe to tour the Caster demesne.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: I pray that Her Grace will not be blinded by her own tears.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: A most suffocating banquet, was it not?
And who might you be?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: You may call me Clovisia. Based on that distinctive white hair of yours, you must be Lady Allerdale Cumberland.
Madam Ailshie of your estate has ordered some outfits for the upcoming season from our shop, but I'm afraid we haven't finalized the details of yours quite yet.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Sorry, I couldn't help but overhear your conversation with Earl Morris. It seems your reputation as a critic of the arts is well-earned.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: You flatter me. I presume you too are concerned about the present situation in Londinium.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Hardly, hardly. It's just rather difficult to not listen in as the clientÃ¨le discuss the recent changes when you work at a tailor's.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: *sigh* It's getting dark. I should head home. Once you've settled on a design, please have Madam Ailshie contact me at your convenience.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Ah, right, speaking of Madam Ailshie, she asked me to pass you the Londinium Daily.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Farewell.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Might as well see if there's anything else newsworthy today, I suppose.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: A vicious brawl in Norport Borough?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Is that...?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Feckin' 'ell! That's bloody ridiculous is what it is!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: It's the third time this month. Been accident after accident here in the factory ever since that scoundrel took over the union.
attributes.name: Wronged Worker

attributes.content: Watch close enough and you start to notice how whenever some brave soul puts out a complaint about the union, he ends up dead in some freak accident a few days later.
attributes.name: Wronged Worker

attributes.content: Let's go then already! Take me to 'im. I'm gonna see just how brass this bastard's balls are!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Calm down! The union handles union business, the street handles street business. That's the rule.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Giving every bastard I see a right thrashing's my rule!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I know! Of course I know... But we've got no other choice.
attributes.name: Wronged Worker

attributes.content: The union's keeping it all hush-hush inside the factory. Not even the coppers can investigate.
attributes.name: Wronged Worker

attributes.content: This new foreman... Johnny, right? Who's behind him?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I remember hearing he's got some big name backing him. A relative of Duke Davendich, apparently...
attributes.name: Wronged Worker

attributes.content: Do you mean Duke Cavendish?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Yeah! That's the one!
attributes.name: Wronged Worker

attributes.content: Is he trying to get anything out of you lot?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hasn't been asking for money or any of the sort... but ever since he became foreman, lots of the important jobs are getting taken up by workers from outside.
attributes.name: Wronged Worker

attributes.content: I see. You head on back. We need to talk this over a bit.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: What're we waiting around for, Morgan?! Are we gonna let these bastards do as they like?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: It's not that simple.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You heard the man. This isn't your average union tosser. He's got the backing of a duke. Why's he going out of his way to play tyrant in some little factory, though?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Who cares why?! Since when did we need a reason to take out buggers like him?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I know Londinium's rather restless these days. The dukes've been playing their games around the clock. Don't tell me you haven't noticed all these fresh faces on the street lately?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Time to come up with a plan, Vina. We're all ears.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Since we've taken their protection money, it's up to us to do the legwork.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Let's go have a chat with this bastard of a foreman. Doesn't matter if he's got a duke behind him.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: That's more like it!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Alright, if you say so, Vina...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But just to be safe, we should scope out the factory a bit, get some info. You're with me, Baird.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Hey! Why didn't you ask me?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: What's wrong? You've been looking rather glum lately.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It's nothing. I was just thinking... I might be enjoying myself a little too much.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: What, not too happy here?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You have a duty, Siege.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I've told you before, Dagda.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I've found a life for myself now, so whyâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Is this life of yours helping your neighbors seek the justice of the streets, then heading to the noble manors to lob a few bricks?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: There's no escaping some things.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: You promised me you wouldn't talk about this in the gym.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Then I'll stay by your side, waiting for the day you have your answer.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.text: Life is long, but the pivotal moments that change you? They're over in an instant.
\nI recall that one afternoon, before the chaos of the storm struck us, when we could still enjoy those peaceful hours.
\nIndra didn't speak to me the whole day on account of my hesitation. Baird had to step in and smooth things over between us, and by nightfall we were all happy as could be, buying hot dogs and beer.
But I couldn't shake off the feeling that the Glasgow Gang was about to enter the craziest chapter of this story yet.
\nIt wasn't until those wild dreams of ours came to an end that I realized the most pressing issue...
\nThe main character of this tale wasn't the Glasgow Gang. It was Vina. Just Vina, all along.

attributes.content: What's the matter, Ailshie?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Did you not instruct us to keep a close eye on Her Royal Highness Alexandrina's whereabouts?
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: The chief of the Royal Police has just looked over the case file of that ghastly brawl in Norport.
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: It involved a video shop known as McClaren's Place and a street gang going by the name of Glasgow.
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: Here is the original copy of the file.
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: It's rather vague, merely a record of the involved parties, but I thought you ought to know.
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: Upon a fuzzy black-and-white photograph, a woman sucking on a lollipop stares indignantly at the camera.
'Person of Interest: Siege (self-identified)'
Miss Allerdale, if you are near-certain she is Her Royal Highness... Why not seek her out immediately?
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: And what then? I bring her back to Cumberland Manor? Or send her off to Caster?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Whether or not she is Alexandrina no longer matters. The dukes are watching her closely. She can escape them no longer.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: It sounds to me like she would be swallowed by the city itself.
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: Hah. We'll be swallowed too, Ailshie.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I'm willing to bet we're not the only ones with an interest in her. This matter has long since grown out of my control.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Considering Duke Caster's orders, should you not find her and bring her to Her Grace?
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: I need some time to think, Ailshie.
attributes.name: Allerdale
Allerdale
attributes.content: I saw her once before. I saw...

attributes.name: Allerdale
attributes.content: Her Royal Highness.
But no matter how you put it, it was all such a long time ago. Things being what they are, is an unknown heir truly so important?
attributes.name: Ailshie

attributes.content: It's merely an inkling... From the very first time I saw her, so many years ago, I always believed she would change things.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Let's go. There's a few workers I need to pop in on. I would also like to know how Her Highness has been doing these past few years.
attributes.name: Allerdale
Cruel Foreman
attributes.content: Who's there?!

attributes.name: Cruel Foreman
attributes.content: Grkâ€”
The coast is clear.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I've handled this side too.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: This is it. The place Charlie told us about.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We heard some chatter. Lately, the union's been keeping a whole bunch of goods inside this old factory, like they were a smuggling ring.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Johnny seized control of the union not just to skim some funds, but to do this sort of business.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: What's inside those containers?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Just open 'em up and we'll find outâ€”
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah! Slowâ€”
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Are those...?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: ...Originium weapons.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: They're not standard Victorian issue. No idea of their actual provenance though.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Duke Cavendish's man sneakily taking over a factory, all so he can move weapons from God-knows-where into Londinium? What's he playing at here?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The dukes quietly stockpiling weapons within the city can only mean one thing.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: And now we've left our fingerprints all over the place...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: What do we do now, Vina? Looks to me like it's something way bigger than we can handle.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: We can't handle it ourselves, but we can tell others.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Got a light, Hannah?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Bloody hell, you can still see the factory burning from all the way out here!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: This is no laughing matter, Indra!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Of course it is! We messed up some wicked duke's scheme!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: We... did something really big here.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: At least we can say we've done nothing wrong, yeah?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Let the coppers handle the rest of it.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: They say Londinium's so big it defies borders, but at times I feel it's rather small. Wouldn't you agree?
Who would have thought I would meet you here, Alexandrina. Your Royal Highness.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: Who are you?!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I'm Morrill, a humble guest at the Cavendish estate. Nobody in particular. And yet, I would say I'm one lucky chap.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: You know about the factory... You know what Duke Cavendish is up to.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Though I can boast of sharing some of the Duke's burdens, I was not wholly in the know about His Grace's plans for Londinium.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: However, at this moment, my only concern is you, Your Royal Highness Alexandrina.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: I must say, seeing Your Highness standing before me really does call to mind the sight of His Majesty, all those years ago.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: You and he are so very alike. The same childish sense of justice, the same... price you must pay for clinging to it.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: What do you want?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Your little adventure with your friends this evening... Hardly matters, I say. A few boxes of lost merchandise is hardly anything compared to meeting you.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: Come now. At the very least, I'll let your chums leave alive. How about that?
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: Why should I believe a word you're saying?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Excuse my impertinence, Your Highness, but the truth is you have no other choice.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: Or should I say, you are free to try and escape, but I will be keeping a close eye on your whereabouts.
attributes.name: Earl Morrill

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina! The hell're you doing?!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Stop swinging already! You've nearly beaten him dead!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: *huff*... *huff*...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It's fine, he's still breathing.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Vina... What's this all about?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You lot... Get out of here.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The factory, all this, it was all my doing. Nothing to do with anyone else.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Are you havin' a laugh?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Vina... What was he saying? Why'd he keep calling you 'Your Royal Highness'?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: ...Because she's the heir to the throne of Victoria.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: The daughter of the late King Alistair II, Alexandrina Vina Victoria.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I... I didn't mean to hide it. I just thought... It didn't really matter...
attributes.name: Vina
Indra
attributes.content: You daft, mate?

attributes.name: Indra
attributes.content: I'm not asking who you are, I'm asking why you'd try and shoulder all this by yourself!
Hannah...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Sounds like there's a long story you need to be telling us.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Sorry...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No time for that! Save it, we need to leave right now!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Where can we go, though?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Out the city.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Right now. This instant. Immediately.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I can'tâ€”
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We're nearly out of time. Once the police notice the factory's up in flames, they'll contact the Defense Forces and shutter each and every port. When that happens, we wouldn't be able to fly out, even if we sprouted wings.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Don't worry about Norport. I'll hold the fort.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Wait, Baird, you're not coming with?! Hey, Morgan, say something, won't you?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I get where she's coming from. The Glasgow Gang's always going to be home to us, Hannah.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Someone's gotta welcome you lot home when you get back, right?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: People are watching you. But I'm sorry, Vina. We can't protect you. Against real titans like them, the Gang's nothing more than puny little musbeasts.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: You were never a Norporter, Vina. Or should I say, never only a Norporter. I knew from the day you joined us.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: It's all my fault. I just wanted to protect you all, but... but now, I've dumped a heap of trouble on your laps.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Not wrong. If you're going to blame yourself, though, there's something I hope you keep in mind.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Remember that you owe Norport. Remember that one day, you'll need to come back here to repay everyone.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I swear. I swear I'll come back.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Yeah! It's our turf, after all! We'll snatch it right back someday!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: But are you really set on coming with me? There's no need to tangle yourselves in all this.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I'm your trusted advisor, Vina. I'm worried for you.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: If anyone comes looking to bother you, you're gonna need me to help bash their faces in!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Wherever you go, Vina, I will follow.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Never forget, Vina. No matter where you go, the Glasgow Gang will be with you.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I'll keep this place safe. We won it together, after all.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I promise you, Baird. I'll bring everyone back.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Hopefully sooner rather than later.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Here's to us. To the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: To the Glasgow Gang!
attributes.name: Everyone

attributes.content: Dammit, dammit all... M-My Lady! It's the Duke of Cavendish's man!
attributes.name: Flustered Clerk

attributes.content: My Lady, I-I'll contact Headquarters right away! Even if we must turn all of Londinium upside-downâ€”
attributes.name: Flustered Clerk

attributes.content: Suppress this event.
Very well, I'm contacting the hospitalâ€”What? Suppress it?
attributes.name: Flustered Clerk

attributes.content: I will have my men handle this. Nothing to come will have anything to do with the Norport Police.
Do not worry. The chief of the Royal Police will not come calling on you about this or anyone else on scene, for that matter.
R-Really? How can you be so sure...?
attributes.name: Flustered Clerk

attributes.content: While I cannot fix the future's course, sir, I <i>can<i> guide it towards a path of my liking.
This city will soon be welcoming a host of visitors. Do you not have more important things to handle?
You... Alright... Very well!
attributes.name: Flustered Clerk

attributes.content: This too is part of your destiny, Vina.

attributes.text: When we found out about Vina's past, I was amazed, sure, but I was more pleasantly surprised, as it were.
\nI could see the entire story in my mind's eye. A lost heir to the throne, a heroic fantasy rising from the streets.
\nStories usually start with someone leaving, and end with a reunion. But reality begs to differ.
When we stepped out on the road away from home, none of us expected the way back could be so fraught with hardship.
\nI'm fond of the words Dagda spoke once we set foot on our home again, after many, many years away:
'History is like a sailing ship adrift, and every age sees its share of experienced helmsmen who think to change its course...'
\n'But in the end, none will truly ever know where the sunset and the river will take them.'

attributes.content: Hey, who're you? Here to get some rounds in the ring?
attributes.name: Gang Member

attributes.content: I'd like to ask if this is where the Glasgow Gang is based? I'm looking for Siege. If I understand things right, she's your leader?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: This gym's only got one leader now. She's called Baird.
attributes.name: Gang Member

attributes.content: Wait a sec... Lookin' at your clothes, you a noble?
attributes.name: Gang Member

attributes.content: Get out. You ain't welcome here.
attributes.name: Gang Member

attributes.content: Pardon me, then.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: You're looking for Vina? You know her?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I'm... an old friend of hers.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Vina's out on a trip. If you've got something to say, I can pass it on for you.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: No, nothing in particular. It's just that as her friend, I'm concerned about her current situation.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Please let her know I'm wishing her all the best, when you can.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Sure. She's doing fine. I'll tell her on your behalf.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Allerdale turns and leaves the messy gym. She knows the woman there wasn't lying. Because she saw the photo hanging on the wall, and the smiling face upon it.
It's not time yet.
In her fit of absent-mindedness, that deep, resonant voice arises in her head once more.
'Allerdale Cumberland.'
'You will meet Vina again, someday.'
